title: Blueprint, "Albright  Art Gallery: Library Elevations", October 18, 1932
medium: Blueprint and graphite on white wove paper, double ruled border
markings: Architect's stamp at lower right: EDW. B. GREEN & SON/ARCHITECTS/ONE NIAGARA SQUARE/BUFFALO, N.Y.
inscribed: Architect's stamp inscribed in lower right corner: LIBRARY, PLAN ELEVATIONS/DETAILS; ALBRIGHT ART GALLERY/BUFFALO N.Y.; 1/4"=1'-0" / 1/2"=1'-0" / 1 1/2"=1'-0"; 10-15-32; Inscribed above architect's stamp: PRINTED OCT. 18, 1932; 1 [circled]; Inscribed with dimensions, descriptions and notes throughout; Inscribed on verso in orange pencil: Buffalo Library; in graphite below: For Wm. Hengerer Co.
description: Blueprint of elevations and floor plans for library, Albright Art Gallery, Buffalo, NY. Floor plan at center shows square-shaped room, surrounded by built in shelves and cabinets on all four walls, three large rectangular library tables arranged in the center, and a card index unit on right wall, door at right. Typewriter desk positioned perpendicular to doorway. Wall elevations show dimensions of shelves. In lower left corner is design for print boxes in three different sizes, to be placed on sliding shelves.

tombstone.epitaph:
Blueprint, "Albright  Art Gallery: Library Elevations", October 18, 1932.
October 18, 1932. Blueprint and graphite on white wove paper, double ruled border. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-301.
